org.jdesktop.jdic.fileutil
Interface FileUtil

All Known Implementing Classes:
MacOSXFileUtil, SolarisFileUtil, UnixFileUtil, Win32FileUtil
public interface FileUtil

Method Summary
 BigInteger getFreeSpace(File file)
          Return the amount of free bytes available in the directory or file referenced by the file Object.
 boolean recycle(File file)
          Sends the file or directory denoted by this abstract pathname to the Recycle Bin/Trash Can.
 boolean recycle(File file, boolean confirm)
          Sends the file or directory denoted by this abstract pathname to the Recycle Bin/Trash Can.
 

Method Detail

recycle

boolean recycle(File file)
                throws IOException,
                       SecurityException
Sends the file or directory denoted by this abstract pathname to the Recycle Bin/Trash Can. It's a convenience method, works in the same way than delete(File file, true).

Parameters:
file - the file or directory to be recycled.
Returns:
true if and only if the file or directory is successfully recycled; false otherwise.
Throws:
IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
SecurityException - If a required system property value cannot be accessed.

recycle

boolean recycle(File file,
                boolean confirm)
                throws IOException,
                       SecurityException
Sends the file or directory denoted by this abstract pathname to the Recycle Bin/Trash Can.

Parameters:
file - the file or directory to be recycled.
confirm - true shows a confirmation dialog; false recycles without notification.
Returns:
true if and only if the file or directory is successfully recycled; false otherwise.
Throws:
IOException - If the file doesn't exist or if an I/O error occurs.
SecurityException - If a required system property value cannot be accessed.

getFreeSpace

BigInteger getFreeSpace(File file)
                        throws IOException
Return the amount of free bytes available in the directory or file referenced by the file Object.

Parameters:
file -
Returns:
the amount of free space in the Disk. The size is wrapped in a BigInteger due to platform-specific issues.
Throws:
IOException
